snippet: Samuel Mullet Sr. and 15 followers were sentenced to prison for a series of assaults that prosecutors said were motivated by religious intolerance.
abstract: Samuel Mullet Sr, leader of dissident Amish sect, is sentenced to 15 years in prison for series of bizarre beard- and hair-cutting attacks on other Ohio Amish that prosecutors say were motivated by religious intolerance; 15 of his followers, including six women, are given lesser sentences.
lead_paragraph: Samuel Mullet Sr. and 15 followers were sentenced to prison for a series of assaults that prosecutors said were motivated by religious intolerance.

headline.seo: Amish Sect Leader Gets 15 Years in Beard-Cutting Attacks
headline.main: Amish Sect Leader Sentenced to 15 Years in Hair-Cutting Attacks
headline.print_headline: Amish Sect Leader Sentenced to 15 Years in Hair-Cutting Attacks
